info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 1:53PM MDT until June 23 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 153 PM MDT, Emergency responders reported flash flooding was ongoing in the vicinity of Bear Canyon due to thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the far eastern portion of the Salt Fire Burn Scar. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen, mainly over the Bear Canyon basin. While storms have begun drifting east, additional development is still possible, and runoff will continue for some time.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Salt Fire Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Salt Fire Burn Scar.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Areas near U.S. Highway 70 north of Apache Summit to the Otero Lincoln County line.
info.instruction:
This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Salt Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
